intro: Telipogon sarae, commonly known as the Sarae star grass, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant is typically found in high-altitude environments, where it thrives in cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces tiny, wind-pollinated flowers that contribute to its ecological role in alpine ecosystems. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Telipogon sarae is considered a rare and specialized species.
